title: BBC Local Live: Channel Islands on Monday 15 January 2018 - BBC News
summary: human remains confirmed and shotgun found in burnt-out car in guernsey .
five-year peak in jersey high value resident approvals . is billionaire roman abramovich one of them ?
being a patient in jersey 's general hospital 'like living on a building site ' .
constable halts jersey church extension work .
- rector suffers 'vitriolic personal attacks ' by church extension critics .
armed police block parade road in jersey .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 07:00 on tuesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for the channel islands have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 07:00 on tuesday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight for the channel islands on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .

documents.title: weather : clear spells and blustery showers
text: there will be a mixture of clear spells and blustery showers tonight , with lower temperatures accentuated by continuing strong winds .
minimum temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .
tuesday will be a day of sunny spells and blustery showers , with the showers turning increasingly wintry , perhaps allowing a little snow over high ground .
remaining cold and very windy , with severe gales possible in places .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: vehicle wrecks jersey club 's football pitch
text: `` significant damage '' was caused to the turf of a football pitch in st peter when a car was `` deliberately '' driven around it , police have said .
it happened some time between 18:00 on 12 january and 11:00 the following morning at the jersey wanderers football club pitch .
officers said this is the second time the pitch had been damaged , and a similar incident took place in late december .
groundsman julian wright said he was `` gutted '' at the damage caused , and the pitch could be out of service for `` months '' .
the marks are quite deep , '' he said .
`` it will take a while to fix . ''
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: rector appeals for calm over church loo plans
text: the rector of st lawrence has appealed for calm among his parishioners after a dispute over a toilet extension stopped the work .
work on the controversial £ 80,000 extension at st lawrence church has been halted by the parish constable and the rector because of the disagreement until a parish assembly is carried out .
the reverend phil warren has contacted the police over what he describes as vitriolic personal attacks against him .
there is no need for them , they are unnecessary , at the end of the day we are talking about a building that serves the community .
myself , those involved in this process have done all of this in good faith .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'no link ' between burnt out car and military involvement
text: guernsey police say there 's no evidence connecting a missing man 's links to an anti-russian movement in ukraine and his car being found burnt out in guernsey .
mikus alps , a 33-year-old latvian national , has been missing in the island for a week .
his car was found on monday 8 january containing a shotgun and human remains , subject to further tests .
'we are aware that mr alps has connections with a pro-ukrainian and anti-russian movement , '' chief officer patrick rice said .

`` given that it is yet to be formally confirmed whether mr alps is alive or deceased , there is no concrete evidence at this stage linking his involvement with this movement to his car being found burnt out . ''
a facebook video posted by a group calling itself the 8th battalion of the ukrainian volunteer army appears to show mr alps talking to fighters .
the group , which claims to have taken part in key battles in the conflict with russia , says mr alps travelled to ukraine to bring supplies .
in the video mr alps said he was visiting the country for the first time to see the situation for himself after talking with latvian friends about the conflict .
he goes on to say he has military experience , including serving in a military unit as a machine gunner .
in the video mr alps is seen with two women holding the guernsey flag .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: guernsey schools 'jumped at the chance ' to join mile scheme
text: schools in guernsey jumped at the chance to join a scheme asking children to run or walk every day for at least 15 minutes according to the guernsey lifelong learning manager .
it gets them ready for school more , it gets them engaged for learning .
the schools have jumped at the opportunity and we are really pleased .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: rnli st helier mechanic resigns
text: the mechanic working for the rnli at its lifeboat station in st helier has resigned , the charity has confirmed .
a spokeswoman said the departure was due to him `` wanting to spend more time with his family '' .
as a result , the rnli said the responsibility for maintaining the charity 's inshore lifeboat would be covered by members of staff based at the island 's st catherine 's station .
she added technicians from poole in dorset would be brought over to jersey `` as needed '' to repair and maintain the st helier station 's all-weather lifeboat .
the mechanic has been praised by the charity for `` many years of excellent service '' , which added that recruitment for the full-time , paid position `` would n't take too long '' .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: new hospital and care inquiry set to dominate year 's first states sitting
text: two to that dominated politics last year - the new hospital and the independent jersey care inquiry - are likely to be at the forefront of the first states sitting of 2018 .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: shotgun found in burnt out car
text: shotgun found in burnt out car

documents.title: five rescued by rnli st helier inshore lifeboat
text: five people were rescued by rnli volunteers in jersey this weekend after two the boats they were on had problems .
one of the boats had mechanical problems and the other was running low on fuel .
the st helier inshore lifeboat helped the people on board a 5m-long motor boat which ran out of fuel on its way back from guernsey .
they had been assisting another motor boat which had mechanical issues .
the inshore lifeboat , crewed by existing rnli volunteers and rnli-trained fire and rescue personnel , took one motor boat in tow and escorted the other back to st helier .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: gale force winds continuing
text: wind warning № 49/1 , issued at 15:08 utc , 15/01/2018 .

documents.title: is abramovich among new wealthy residents in jersey ?
text: more high wealth individuals were given permission to live in jersey in 2017 than the previous five years , figures from the states have shown .
the jersey evening post reports one of the 34 successful applicants last year was the russian billionaire and owner of chelsea football club , roman abramovich .
in 2012 , 12 people were given the special status .
what is a high value resident ( hvr ) ?
you can view the full criteria here .
the last five years has seen a gradual increase in the amount of hvr 's granted `` entitled '' status .
a spokesman for the states of jersey said they did not comment on individual cases involving hvr 's
a spokesman for millhouse llc , which represents mr abramovich 's business interests , also refused to comment .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: jersey hospital 'getting old and needs constant work '
text: a jersey deputy says the jersey general hospital `` is getting old and needs constant work '' to keep it going .
richard rondel is having cancer treatment and said a new hospital was urgently required as money was constantly needed to keep the current building operational .
he was speaking after environment minister deputy steve luce rejected outline planning permission for the redevelopment of the £ 460m hospital on the current site .
i was in a room , i had to change room in the middle of the night because the bathroom started leaking .
it leaked into the room i was in and i had to move room .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: 'arrests made , but not necessarily linked to mikus alps '
text: arrests have been made concerning `` ancillary matters '' by police investigating the case of missing latvian national mikus alps , guernsey police 's chief officer has confirmed .
the 33-year-old was last seen in the early hours of monday 8 january , the same day a car registered to him was discovered burnt out , containing human remains and a shotgun .
at a press conference , patrick rice said : `` there have been arrests made , not necessarily linked to this investigation .
`` there are ancillary matters that we have investigated .
`` a person has been charged and is currently remanded in custody . ''
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: islanders urged to avoid speculating about human remains
text: guernsey 's senior police officer has appealed for islanders to avoid speculating and spreading rumours as investigations into the discovery of human remains in a burnt out car continue .

guernsey 's head of law enforcement , patrick rice , said he would `` not normally comment on rumour and speculation '' and international media reports , but the level around this case was `` fairly unprecedented '' .
he said : `` regurgitating rumour on social media does not make it fact no matter how many times it is repeated . ''
he urged those posting online or passing on rumours to be `` mindful of the impact such speculation has on those who have potentially lost a loved one '' .
author: Ben Chapple
BBC News Online

documents.title: human remains found in petit bot car : what we know
text: after human remains were found in a burnt out car at petit bot last monday , guernsey police have released further details today .
this is what can be said so far :
author: Ben Chapple
BBC News Online

documents.title: missing latvian man : shotgun retrieved from burnt out car
text: guernsey police are still appealing for information concerning mikus alps , the 33-year-old missing in guernsey .
a car belonging to mr alps was found burnt out in a secluded part of petit bot , st martin , last monday .
police confirmed parts of human bone and a shotgun were retrieved from the vehicle .
mr alps , a latvian national , moved to guernsey in 2005 , police chief patrick rice confirmed in a press conference this afternoon .
he worked in the motor trade and lived with his mother , he added .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: petit bot car : police 'have letter from missing man '
text: a letter purportedly from missing latvian man mikus alps has been received by guernsey police , officers say .
chief officer patrick rice would not confirm its contents but said it was sombre and reflective '' .
handwriting experts were analysing the letter , he added .
he also confirmed a shotgun was recovered from the burnt-out car .
the vehicle belonged to mr alps , 33 , who was last seen in the early hours of monday 8 january , police said .
the force found the car near petit bot , st martin , that morning .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: guernsey police update on missing person investigation
text: guernsey police update on missing person investigation
author: BBC Channel Islands News

documents.title: fibre internet and landlines down in jersey
text: telecoms companies jt and sure say they 're having problems with the majority of fibre landline phone services across jersey .
engineers are working to get all services restored throughout the day and the companies apologised for any inconvenience .
issues with fibre landline services in jersey today , apologies for any inconvenience .
service will be restored as soon as possible .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: reds delighted with home quarter-final
text: reds delighted with home quarter-final

documents.title: church extension row rector suffers 'vitriolic attacks '
text: the rector of st lawrence has contacted the police over what he describes as `` vitriolic personal attacks '' against him .
the reverend phil warren said ill feeling towards him over a proposed extension to the parish church had spilled over into unnecessary abuse .
its been a hugely controversial development .
the church wants to build an extension onto an historic doorway to provide worshippers with a toilet and a kitchen .
heritage campaigners have strongly opposed the idea , claiming it would spoil the church 's heritage .
rev warren and the constable have called a parish assembly to discuss the matter .
he said that would give a clear idea of what churchgoers wanted .
work on the controversial £ 80,000 extension has been halted by the parish constable .
deidre mezbourian suspended the work with the agreement of rev warren .
author: Chris Stone
BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: vance remains positive despite 1-0 loss
text: vance remains positive despite 1-0 loss

documents.title: jersey sports lottery scrapped over low ticket sales
text: the jersey sports lottery , which was launched last year to raise money for sports clubs and associations , has been cancelled over low ticket sales .

the lottery was launched in august but failed to catch on and , after five months , organisers decided ticket sales were `` nowhere near the levels required to meet the goal of selling 5,000 tickets '' , according to a spokesman .
he said : `` we 're disappointed that the slow rate of ticket sales left us with no realistic alternative than the decision we 've taken .
`` we apologise to those who 'd bought tickets and will be refunding their money promptly . ''
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: states workers urged to reject public-sector overhaul
text: states workers will be balloted this week and urged to reject a £ 47 million overhaul of the public sector .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: guernseyman and former greenpeace skipper dies in plymouth
text: guernseyman john castle , known for years for his campaign work with greenpeace , has died in hospital in plymouth of cancer .
he was 67 .
mr castle was involved in many greenpeace campaigns , from those against nuclear testing on the french pacific atolls , to anti-whaling missions on board the charity 's ship rainbow warrior .
mr castle had not been involved with the organisation for a number of years and was living in south east cornwall .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: eight guernsey schools going that extra 'daily mile '
text: pupils at eight schools across the bailiwick of guernsey are being asked to run or walk every day for at least 15 minutes .
guernsey 's lifelong learning manager said the initiative , known as the daily mile , had grown into an international phenomenon with more than 3,000 schools around the world now involved .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: prices 'could rise as a result of credit card charge ban '
text: prices for channel islands customers could rise as a result of a uk law banning credit card surcharges according to anne king , head of the jersey consumer council .

the new law , which does n't apply in the channel islands , came into effect on saturday and means retailers in the uk have to charge everyone the same price for the same items , regardless of how you pay for them .
the move is meant to benefit consumers , but it 's led to concerns that businesses may try to cover their costs by increasing their prices .
stephen taylor , who owns the cock and bull pub in guernsey , said they dropped credit card fees last year and raised prices to compensate .
he said there had been a positive response from customers .
author: Freddie Miller
Broadcast Journalist BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: wind warning issued by jersey met
text: jersey met has issued a wind warning for the channel islands with gales up to force eight with gusts to 50 knots expected .
wind warning № 48/1 , issued at 08:50 utc , 15/01/2018 .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: public meeting over guernsey school reform proposals
text: there will be a chance for parents and others to get more information on proposed reforms to guernsey 's education system at a public meeting tonight .
on wednesday , politicians will debate the future structure of the island 's education system .
there are two main proposals : one creating three community secondary schools supported by the education committee , and a two-school model proposed as an alternative .
the committee said that three community schools , including a rebuild of la mare de carteret , was the right way forward for local students , parents and staff .
the meeting takes place at beau sejour at 19:30 .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: weather : becoming brighter and showery
text: occasionally heavy rain will clear during the morning , leaving brighter conditions but also blustery showers for the remainder of the day .
it will be windy throughout , with gales in places , especially in more exposed areas like les landes .
maximum temperature : 12c ( 54f ) .
jersey :
guernsey :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: strong turnout for grandes rocques beach clean
text: twenty-four bags of litter were up from cobo and port soif at the weekend during a highly-successful beach clean .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: breakingtwo arrested after parade fight on sunday
text: two men have been arrested after being involved in a fight on the parade in jersey on sunday morning , police say .
armed police were called after reports a knife had been seen and one officer drew a taser , although it was not fired .
parade road was sealed off until both men were taken into custody .
a 32-year-old-man is being held on sus of possessing an offensive weapon and a 44-year-old is suspected of causing a breach of the peace by fighting .
neither have yet been charged .
author: Chris Stone
BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: public meeting to discuss skate park after vandalism
text: skateboarders in jersey will be able to have their say on a new skate park at a public meeting .
deputy russell labey has called it following the closure of the new quay skate park last week .
it was closed after vandals threw concrete blocks and skateboards into the marina .
it will be reopened on weekends and school holidays but only until september .
deputy labey said the meeting , on 6 february at the town hall , would give skateboarders a chance to discuss where they would like a new skate park and what it should include .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: removing taxi knowledge test 'goes in the wrong direction '
text: removing the knowledge test that taxi drivers have to take in guernsey would be a step in the wrong direction , according to the president of the island 's taxi federation , leon gallienne .
it follows proposals in jersey to review the test as part of `` improvements '' to the island 's taxi industry .
the test asks drivers the route they would take between certain points , naming the roads they would drive along on their journey .
mr gallienne said that having a good knowledge of the island was integral to the job .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: constable halts church extension work
text: work on the controversial £ 80,000 extension at st lawrence church has been halted by the parish constable .
deidre mezbourian suspended the work with the agreement of the rector , reverend phil warren .
parishioners opposed to the toilet extension have claimed it is unsuitable for the historic building .
its supporters said the scheme would give older people and children somewhere to use the toilet during long services .
a parish assembly will be held on this matter , but no date has been set .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: avoid green street car park 'if you need the lift '
text: drivers who ca n't use stairs are being advised not to use the green street multi-storey car park from today as the lift is being replaced .
the lifts in the green street and sand street car parks are 45-years-old and so the infrastructure department is replacing them .
there will still be one lift in use in the sand street car park while the other is replaced .
green street only has a single lift , so drivers are being advised to use an alternative car park if they need to use a lift .
after sand street and green street car park lifts are replaced , the infrastructure department will modernise pier road lifts .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: jersey hospital like 'living on a building site '
text: a jersey deputy has described being a patient in jersey general hospital as like `` living on a building site '' .
deputy richard rondel , who is being treated for cancer , said there was constant work needed on the building to keep it operating .
he said he had to be moved in the night because of leaking bathrooms and thin curtains meant there was little privacy .
it 's almost a week since the planning minister turned down plans for a new hospital .
an independent planning inspector agreed that the current site was the right location , but described the design as `` over-dominant , obtrusive and an alien structure '' .
mr rondel agreed that a re-design was needed , but it needed to be quick `` so we can begin building a new hospital that the patients and nurses of the island deserve '' .
he said : `` these things should not be happening .
we 've gone through a whole process of looking at different sites .
this is the right site , it 'll be great for st helier , great for the staff who live and work in st helier . ''
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: father jailed after police find cannabis at his home
text: a father has been jailed for 12 weeks after police found nearly 100 grams of cannabis in his family home during a drugs raid .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: armed police blocked parade road on sunday
text: armed police blocked off a road in st helier in jersey on sunday after an incident near the general hospital .
officers were alerted shortly after 11:30 , when hospital staff called them .
it is understood the incident did not involve a patient .
at least one officer with a firearm helped to block off nearby parade road .
a police spokesperson said the issue was resolved , but would n't give further details .
author: Chris Stone
BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: human remains in burnt-out guernsey car
text: human skeletal remains were found in a burnt-out car belonging to a latvian man , police have confirmed .
the vehicle was registered to mikus alps , 33 , who lived on the island and had previously been reported missing , guernsey police said .
it was found near petit bot in st martin on 8 january .
officers also confirmed that no other remains had been found , and the identity of the dead person was not known .
a post-mortem examination is due to be carried out later this week .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for monday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for the channel islands today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online
